channel.title: New video card
channel.description:
I've been looking for a new video card that will play games with little to no lag. My spending range is around $100-$200, so don't suggest any high end graphic cards that are pretty much good enough they don't serve a point, other than saying you have a beast graphics card. One that I've found tempting is: http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/searchtools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=41125&pagenumber=2&RSort=1&csid=ITD&recordsPerPage=5&body
It looks nice, but I would like to have suggestions for this video card or any other recommended video card someone with experience thinks is decent.

item.title: New video card
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/

Read full topic

item.title: New video card
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

well you need to do the research on which one to get.(Duel screens-more ram is better, how you want it clocked, etc)

also make sure your power source can handle it. I believe a 500+ watt will work, stock won’t.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

he may mean the actual gigabyte brand of 560 ti,

item.title: New video card
item.dc:creator: @Jaxus Jaxus
item.description:
@Jaxus wrote:

[quote=“Stu, post:8, topic:462250”][quote author=Niall link=topic=565204.msg4114096#msg4114096 date=1348858832]
if you’re going to go for a 560 you may as well get a 560 ti, the 560 is a gimped card and the 560 ti really isn’t that much more expensive
[/quote]I can vouch on this. I have the Gigabyte version of the 560 TI and I don’t regret it at all.
Oh and thanks Speljohan for the recommendation.[/quote]
This one?
http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=7191453&CatId=3669

Read full topic
